item.title: Clash Mini Update 5 Info Hub!
item.description:
New Hero Progression is here!

  • There are now 15 Hero levels in total, with three main skills respectively unlocked at Hero levels 1, 2, and 3.

  • No more dedicated Hero fragments.

  • Use Crown Shards instead to level up Heroes, and you can choose which Hero to level up.

Hero Skill Upgrades!

  • Each Hero Skill starts at skill level 1 and can be upgraded up to level 4. Skill upgrades require a certain Hero Level.

  • Use Skill Shards to upgrade Hero skills, and you can choose which Hero Skill to upgrade when the skills of different Heroes become upgradable.

New Mini Progression!

  • Each Mini has 3 stars as before, but you do not need dedicated Mini fragments to upgrade them.

  • Now all you need is to collect Star Shards to upgrade the star level of any Mini you wish!

  • We are also introducing Mini Free Trial: Every week, 2 Minis with 3 stars each will be available for all players to try out during the trial period.

Gizmos are here!

  • Gizmos join the battlefield to make Duel & Rumble even more fun!

  • Once you reach 75 Trophies, the Gizmo tutorial will begin and guide you through the basics!

  • Upgrade minis and use stars from those upgrades to deploy a Gizmo of your choice.

  • 10 Gizmos await for you to unlock at different leagues: Silver, Gold, and Diamond.

Emotes? Emotes!

  • Express yourself with Emotes during the battle and in the Clan chat!

New Season, Skins and Board!

  • Welcome to Robo Rumble! A brand new theme of this season, introducing a brand new look.

  • Embark on the Mini Pass Track every month and unlock the premium track via the monthly Mini Pass.

  • Obtain 7 new Robot-themed Skins.

  • Board: Electro Valley has been renovated into Barbtron Plant to echo the Robo Rumble theme this season.

We are introducing new keywords to the game as well!

  • Last: When you are the last unit left in battle.

  • Invulnerable: Immune to damage.

  • Unstoppable: Immune to all control effects: slow, stun, freeze, taunt, and knockback.

  • Silenced: Can’t cast the ability, including Super, Clash, and K.O.

  • Revive: Come back to battle when being K.Oed.

  • Invisible: Can't be targeted by enemies.

And, to just clarify a few other things. When we say...

  • Unit: it refers to Heroes, Minis, and Gizmos.

  • Troop: it refers to Heroes and Minis.

item.title: Welcome to Robo Rumble Update!
item.description:
Patch Notes

  • Gizmos are here! Upgrade your minis, use their stars to deploy powerful Gizmos onto the board, and change the course of battle! Unlock more Gizmos by climbing the Trophy Road!

  • Heroes now have 15 levels, and their skills and overall progression are brand new! Gather Crown Shards, to level up your Heroes, and Skill Shards, to upgrade their skills. Enjoy deeper customization of your favorite Hero.

  • Minis now require Star Shards instead of dedicated Mini duplicates to upgrade their Star level! Star Shards are the universal currency used to upgrade any mini of your choosing and can be obtained from the Shop, Quests, Trophy Road, Expeditions, and of course, Star Exchange.

  • Emotes are here! Unlock special emotes or grab some from the shop and use them during battle to express how you genuinely feel both in matches and in your Clan Chat. 

  • Clash Mini is now 1 year old, and we are celebrating 1 year since the Beta launch with an event in which you can grab a special Emote if you complete event quests in two weeks in December! Good luck!

  • Visual & Audio Overhaul: Clash Mini has a shiny new look, giving it an even more toyetic aesthetic! New audio additions have also been included, such as new battle music for different Battle Boards, new lobby music, and general audio fixes, just to name a few. We are also introducing our first skin set - Robo Rumble, to match the brand-new Season theme.

  • A bunch of improvements and changes to the User Interface! Collection, Main Screen, and other various places now look very different. Check them out!

  • Welcome to the monthly Mini Pass, and the new Mini Pass will start independently of the new game update! Find the Robo Rumble skins and special emotes within the Pass.

  • Clan members expanded to 30, and Boss HP of all three difficulties is 100.

  • Say goodbye to Casual (unranked) matches! Ranked Duel & Rumble matches are now available to everyone. In addition, we added the Ready button in both modes.

  • Introducing Free Mini Trial: time-limited events that occur every week that give you the opportunity to try out featured Minis, even if you haven’t unlocked them yet!

  • Player Level Cap has been increased from 35 to 50.

  • At the end of a Season, the lowest Star count eligible for an optional Star exchange is now 20 instead of 35.

item.title: Weekly Gizmo Rotation is ON!
item.description:
Hello and welcome to Weekly Gizmo Rotation in Clash Mini!

Starting from May 8th, we will introduce 3 Gizmos every week in Duels and Rumbles, so keep an eye out for an in-game pop-up to tell you which 3 Gizmos will be available for everyone that week. You may have to adapt your strategy based on the current Gizmo pool of the week!

Unfortunately, Pocket Artillery is currently suspended due to a bug.

As a refresher, here is the breakdown of each Gizmo that you may encounter in this pool so you utilize them to their fullest potential:

Training Camp

2 Units standing directly to its left and right at the start of the battle will gain +1 ATK every 7s (Can stack). The buff ends if the Training Camp is destroyed. It may work very well with Minis that can already ramp-up their damage over time!

Sauna

The first KOed ally returns to battle after 5s with Super Power! Try putting your heavy-hitting Mini into it ASAP and watch your enemies send “GOOD GAME!” emotes to you!

Pancaker

Throw a delicious pancake to the farthest ally, granting healing and power, when ready! Mini P.E.K.K.A is known to like it, but also Minis that can sustain a lot of damage can benefit from it as well!

Mucho Puncho

Pushes a nearby enemy troop away every few seconds. Works well with defending ranged Minis or keeping heavy-hitting enemy minis at bay.

Elixir Collector

Gains 1 Elixir every few seconds. Suitable for decks that cost a lot of Elixir!

King Tower

Prioritizes targeting Gizmos within its attack range and deals additional damage to Gizmos. Attack Range: 4. This one is a direct counter to all other Gizmos, but also is the most expensive one, so choose wisely!

Hot Pot

Boils in 7s, summoning a Potter (Mini) capable of dealing huge damage! Make sure to protect it for those 7s! After that, it’s cookin’ time.

Saint Mirror

Reflects damage back at each attacker when hit. Great at reflecting big damage dealers or tanking for you!

War Toot

All allies within the area gain 40% attack speed and are immune to all control effects for 3s every 6s. Very helpful if your opponent has a lot of crowd control.

Have fun building decks around these Gizmos, as only 3 of them per week become available, and make sure you notice an in-game pop-up that will show you the weekly rotation in Duels and Rumbles!

item.title: Clash Mini Update 7 Info Hub!
item.description:
Gameplay Change: No Movement & Magic Tiles

Once Hero and Minis are placed onto the board and the round starts, they cannot be moved again or replaced! It is time to be more strategic about your positioning. Respond to your opponent’s placement and change the tide of battle by utilizing Magic Tiles and other Minis that you bring into your deck!

A lot of Minis are reworked as well to accommodate this major change. Gizmos are now going to be available only in future time-limited Events.  In addition, we are also introducing 11 Magic Tiles that rotate across all boards every 24 hours. And last but not least, the Rumble game mode has been transformed into a fun 6-player Draft.

Rank Climbing & Trophy Road

Trophy Road has a brand-new look and now yields repeatable rewards as well (from 800 Trophies and above) for each Rank Reset! Enjoy progressing through more granular stages and reaching certain milestones in each league.

New Troops

Two new Heroes: Grand Warden and Pink Fury, and a brand-new Mini: Dagger Goblin! Shield your allies, deal massive damage with a pink hammer, and poke your opponents with daggers! Grand Warden is available in the free track of the July Mini Pass, Dagger Goblin in the free track of the August Mini Pass, and Pink Fury in the free track of the September Mini Pass of the update!

New Skins, Emotes, & Avatars

Introducing new skins: Space Goblins set (Graxle, Quark, and Flux), Space Guardians set (Starlock, Nebula, and Skyblade), and Abyssal set featuring Countopuss, Walrus, Prince Pinch, and Eelectro Wizard! But that’s not all: We are also introducing animated avatars! Check them all out in the Shop or in the upcoming Mini Passes!

3 Weekly Events Take Turns

Three brand-new duel Events are incoming: Super Elixir, Gizmo Chaos, and Hero Trio. And we heard your feedback. Starting with this update, Events will be available from 00:00 UTC Thursday to 00:00 UTC Monday each week, rotating through the same order.

Other Highlights

Hero Shards are now one currency! Use Hero Shards to upgrade both Heroes' levels and skills. There are also two new ways to obtain more cosmetic rewards in Shop: Luck Box (bought via different in-game resources, requires Exp Level 35) and Crystal Box (bought via Crystal Coins, requires Exp Level 8), which do not offer duplicate cosmetic rewards. Also, you can find these boxes on Mini Pass track. And finally, we are changing Exp Level requirements for some features: Level 10 unlocks Puzzle, Level 20 unlocks Event, Level 25 unlocks Rumble, and Level 35 unlocks Raid Boss.

item.description:
• Clash Mini has become much more strategic! Starting this update, the Hero and Minis you place on the battle board cannot be moved or replaced once the battle starts. The only exception to this rule is Natureborn, who can move one more time in future rounds as per her unique ability to transform.

  • Trophy Road is entirely reworked! New rewards, more granular progress, and repeatable rewards (from 800 Trophies and above) are here for those that experience Rank Reset.

  • Introducing two new Heroes: Grand Warden, who shields his allies - available for free on the July Mini Pass, and Pink Fury, who uses an Elixir Hammer, dealing 3X Elixir Damage to her opponents - available for free on the September Mini Pass.

  • The Rumble mode is now reworked into a 6-player Draft, available for all players with Exp Level 25 or higher.

  • Windy Plains and Healing Temple battle boards are now entirely remade! In addition, Magic Tiles are now independent on the board and will rotate every 24 hours as you play Duel, Rumble, and Event matches. There are now 11 Magic Tiles (unlocked at 80 Trophies) to play with, so make sure to visit Magic Tile info next to the Match button on the main screen each day to learn more about active and upcoming Magic Tiles.

  • Replay a Duel match that you just finished. Speed it up, or slow it down, and learn from what just happened to improve your Clash Mini skills.

  • Optimized Quest experience and the addition of more Quest types! Starting this update, Quests can be completed only via Duel, Rumble, and Event matches.

Luck Box is also the Bonus reward at the end of the Mini Pass track.

1. Movement: Heroes and Minis can move in the pre-battle phase but not after the battle starts and in consecutive rounds.

2. Troop Sale: Minis can be sold in the pre-battle phase but not after the battle starts and in consecutive rounds.

3. Elixir: +6 Elixir each round, and +3 Elixir if lost in the last round.

4. Reroll: +2 Reroll each round

5. Frenzy Time:

Frenzy Time takes effect in the last 10 seconds of each Round. All attacks and Troop abilities cast during Frenzy Time will follow the rules:

  • 3X Hit Speed.

  • -66% Control effect duration, like Stun, Slow, Freeze, Taunt, etc.

  • -66% Defense effect duration, like Invisible, Block, Invulnerable, etc.

  • -66% Healing effect.

6. Magic Tiles:

Magic Tile Rotation begins when players reach 80 Trophies. Rules:

  • 50% chance for a clean board and 50% for a board with the Magic Tile.

  • Magic Tiles will rotate every 24 hours.

  • Magic Tiles will appear and be the same in Round 1 and Round 3.

  • Players can check the current and upcoming Magic Tile information next to the Match button on the main screen.

item.title: Creator Deck Spotlight: Spoob Edition
item.description:
📺 Watch Spoob's video HERE to learn more about these two decks and the strategy behind them!

  • Deck #1:

One of the hardest decks to learn. Pink Fury is your ONLY source of damage, all other minis will pave the way for her to gain maximum value. Strategy: Pink Fury will always be in the back line (middle). This will avoid the chance of fisherman pulling your only true source of damage. Take advantage of a losing streak, gaining 9 elixir on a loss vs 6 elixir for a win. Remember: "Pink Fury will gain attack speed based on how much elixir you SAVE". Round 2: If you won round 1, do not place anything. Let your opponent respond by placing minis on the board. If you lost, Place either a Golden Giant (unleveled) or a Guard with the 3rd ability purchased. Round 3: This is where you start to build your "Unstoppable" strategy. Place Electro Wizard in the far back next to Pink Fury and use his 3rd upgrade to give himself and Pink Fury Energy. You will be gaining this all back thanks to her boast ability Round 4: Place your Healing Ranger and buy her 2nd star upgrade for a wider range. Use the rest of the round to upgrade tanks IE Golden Giant and/or Guard. Round 5: Upgrade Healing Ranger to 3rd ability to give all allies affected by her super, unstoppable. This will make most of your units unaffected by control types (Stuns, Slows, etc) Also, you want to be maxing out your Electro Wizard so he can properly control the board. Prince is mainly used in Round 5 to either stop bowlers, knock back important tanks like Mega Knight or Shield Maiden, or even a 2-star P.E.K.K.A if placed in the front line.

  • Deck #2:

This deck is easy to learn. Remember the placements, and you're bound to win every game. Strategy: Round 1: Place Archer Queen and Healing Ranger upgrade for more health per ability. Round 2: Place Golden Giant to tank damage. If you need more damage, place P.E.K.K.A. Round 3: Upgrade Healing Ranger for extra range to affect tanks and queen and then place Dart Goblin for extra damage. Round 4: Upgrade either Dart Goblin or P.E.K.K.A depending on the situation to deal more damage to the frontline. Queen acts as a last line of defense for Healing Ranger and Dart Goblin. Round 5: Place Prince in front of Archer Queen to bait out Fisherman or enemy Clash units wanting to damage her.

item.title: Introducing SEVEN new Units of Update 8! - Mega Minute
Introducing SEVEN MORE new Units of Update 8! - Mega Minute
SIX MORE new Units, Skins, Boards, Avatars, Emotes, and more! - Mega Minute
Clash Mini Update 8 Info Hub!
item.description:
One New Hero and 19 New Minis Incoming!

Welcome 13 brand-new Minis to the Clash Mini universe with 6 more coming in January alongside a brand-new Hero: Battle Machine!

Unlock new Unit Sets with exciting new gameplay tied to them, pair them with their Classes, and create unique Decks that weren't imaginable before!

All-New Cosmetic Progression!

Refine your Minis and Heroes and unlock cosmetic rewards tied to them: Emotes, that are now automatically used by Minis and Heroes, Avatars, that are tied to their Quality Tier, and the Battle Highlights, side banners that are auto-triggered after your Units reach certain achievements during battle!

But that’s not all! Skin Series are here! By obtaining more Skins and completing their full Series, you will also unlock Boards that can be equipped in Battle!

And with all of this, your Collection has experienced a visual revamp in the form of the brand-new Gallery: featuring Dioramas which display your obtained Skins, Emotes, Avatars, and Boards all in one place! The Gallery is also the place where you can collect passively generating resources from the Piggy Chest, so make sure to log in and claim those often!

New Draft-Tastic Rumble and Hero Promotions!

Rumble is now a 4-Player Draft, and you will be picking from your pool of unlocked Minis and Heroes! It is unlocked for all players that have at least 2 Heroes and 10 Minis. 

In addition, Hero Promotions are here too! Increase your Collector Level by increasing the Quality of your Minis and Heroes, and unlock more Promotion choices for your Heroes during Battle as well. Obtain all 3 Promotion options and choose one to change the tide of Battle with your Hero.

Oh, and one last thing. Heroes can Reposition only once per game now, and during Reposition, Heroes can swap location with any deployed Mini!

Goodbye Stat Level Ups!

Unlocked a Hero? That’s it! Their stats won’t change no matter how many times you Refine their Quality Tier. Now, all Mini and Hero progression is purely cosmetic. All you need to do is unlock those Units, and you're ready to play with them!

Once you grow fond of a certain Mini or Hero, you can spend resources to Refine them and get their cosmetic rewards as you see fit. Remember: Heroes will also receive more Promotion options as you increase your Collector Level!

Major Visual Overhaul!

All of our Minis and Heroes have leveled up visually quite a bit. The entire game of Clash Mini now feels more like a toy store, which is also reflected in our brand-new Cinematic intro that you will be seeing when opening the game for the first time.

Toy Machine and Other Changes

The Toy Machine is here! It is now the only way to obtain the majority of the Skins and some very special Units. Collect Keys to open Toy Machine and add more fun to your Gallery!

Puzzles and Raids are on a hiatus this update. Instead, we are introducing the Battle Log on your Player Profile from which you you can share replays of your last 3 Duel matches directly to your Clan!

And finally, say goodbye to Mini Pass Plus, and say hello to the simplified Mini Pass! You'll progress through the Pass at a steady pace by completing special Quests to earn exciting rewards!

item.title: Clash Mini Ending Development
item.description:
Dear Clash Mini Players,

Ever since the launch of Clash Mini into its Beta, we have strived for one simple thing: to make the best game we could. Our dream is to create great games that as many people as possible play for years and that are remembered forever. Today, we made the decision to end the development of Clash Mini, which was a good game but not the game that would ultimately fulfill our dream.

The past few updates of Clash Mini have shown significant improvements thanks to you on all possible fronts that we cared about, but our quality bar was not met even after all those improvements. Namely, in the last few updates, we have seen peak interest from both our Creator Program and our Community on Reddit and Discord to provide constructive feedback as to how the game could be improved, and we have spent a lot of time trying to fit all of it into the game. We also created incredible content with all of you, from very fun Creator-made Mini Minutes to Stage Channels on Discord and incredibly creative Mini Mondays that highlighted your true love for the game. And for that, we could not be more thankful! It was a blast working alongside you, the community that cared so much about seeing our Mini game grow up.

As the next step, we would like to host one last Discord Stage Channel with the community to honor our tradition and explain how we arrived at this decision after such a journey, so stay tuned for that conversation on the Clash Mini Discord server. We will have our content creators as co-hosts of the conversation, and we want to take you on a journey of our thought process.

However, we can still see very high potential and love for the game within Supercell and our Community. With that in mind, we have decided to commit to bringing the Clash Mini experience to Clash Royale to reach its fullest potential. By doing this, we can better serve many more players in fulfilling our ultimate goal and vision. Once we have concrete updates on the next steps for this development, we intend to share them with you as soon as possible.

Over the coming weeks, here is what you can expect to happen with Clash Mini:

Transferring your in-game purchases:

  • If you have made any in-game purchases in Clash Mini and you play any other Supercell games, you can contact our Player Support team, who will transfer those purchases to another Supercell game.

  • Please note: we can only transfer purchases to any live games. This includes Clash of Clans, Clash Royale, Hay Day, Boom Beach, and Brawl Stars. In addition, please ensure your Supercell ID is connected to both Clash Mini and the other game before initiating the transfer from Clash Mini.

To Contact Support, use the following steps:

  • Open Settings

  • Click "Help & Support" button

  • Tap the blue Chat icon on the top right

  • Click "Leave a message" button

  • Follow the instructions

What are the next steps for the game?

  • In-game purchases will be disabled.

  • A pop-up message will appear in-game, notifying you the closer we get to shutting the game down.

  • We will begin the server shutdown in approximately 6 weeks (late April) to give ample time for players to transfer any in-game purchases to their live Supercell game of choice. After those 6 weeks, the game will be de-listed to prevent new downloads.

We are proud of what we have built with you and cannot be happier with the community we have created around this game. Your love for the game has been something that has been driving us from Day 1 until today. And now, it is time to pack our collection of Minis and stow away the Battle Boards until the next Rumble begins - in the Arena.

We will see you around! -Clash Mini Dev Team
